subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Night Photography with a 35mm
author: Elabeth
full_text:
That seems like an awful lot of extra added crap to me. I'm more of a
keep it simple kinda gal. To me the more stuff you add the less likely
your results aren't tainted somehow. I don't know. I'm even kinda iffy
about introducing the radio to what I do. Maybe that's why I don't get
conversations on it. haha Oh well.

I'm better with a camera than I am with all this voice stuff.

~Elabeth

On Mon, Aug 11, 2008 at 10:56 PM, Chad Wiggins <cawiggins78@...> wrote:
> Look at the videos Mike posted at ufogeek.com
>
> He has 3 radios running through a mixer, plus a mic. White/pink noise mixes
> on the computer. I honestly don't know. Anybody else know anything?
>
> ----- Original Message ----
> From: Elabeth <elabeth@...>
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, August 11, 2008 11:41:30 PM
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Night Photography with a 35mm
>
> LOL, not as far as I know, but then I'm the one asking because I'm not
> getting any results so what do I know?
>
> It generates a bunch of noise on it's own so I wouldn't think any more
> would be necessary. It was my understanding that the messages come
> through "whomever" manipulating the radio voices as it rapidly goes
> from station to station. I'm just recording what comes through the
> radio.
>
> Am I leaving out some important step?
>
> ~Elabeth
>
